Ah, Team Fortress Classic, a relic from an ancient time before hats and crates were all the rage, and when there weren't things like Demoknights and such. Based on the original Team Fortress (yes, this one isn't the first one either), a Quake mod centered around two teams fighting each other, this game offers lots of multiplayer fun. Now, if you're familiar with Team Fortress 2, chances are you know the basics: you play as one of nine classes, as part of either Red or Blue team, and you have to complete different objectives depending on the map; there's the classic modes like Capture the Flag or Control Points, and even a Soccer mode.

There's not a lot more to add; this game is from the GoldSrc era of Valve games, and such it's limited by that engine. Even then, the maps are very well balanced, and you can see several precursors to classic TF2 maps. I should mention that, while having the same 9 classes as TF2 (plus the Civilian in a special gamemode), most of them play nothing alike, besides sharing the basics. Medics, for example, are much more combat suited in this game; there's no Medigun per se, relaying instead on a Medkit to heal his teammates (or poison his enemies), and the Demoman can set up explosive charges in certain maps to open new paths.

While I'd say TF2 is my favourite of the two, this one is a classic, and I've enjoyed it whenever I played it. It even has a small, but active community, so I can recommend it.

You can still find players regularly, 12 vs 12 gameplay, especially depending on the time and day. 

If this game hasn’t fully died yet, then I cannot see how TF2 would die anytime soon unless something crazy happens, which nothing will. 

In terms of gameplay, it might throw off new players, although the game itself is not that bad actually in my opinion, although there isn't much to it. I cannot compare this to TF2 kind of in a sense because of how different the gameplay is, although I still prefer the second one much more, hands down.  The community in TFC isn't always the nicest though towards new players, and I can without question say that TF2 fits more my interests.

Was incredible for its time, but the outdated engine really doesn't work well... combat is awful. It's still a better game than Team Fortress 2, but it's pretty painful to play due to the outdated hit detection and stuttery netcode.

If are a fan of classic games, valve games, and team fortress 2, you might want to visit and get this classic game! It has the original Team Fortress feel, with multiplayer servers, weapons, classic troop types, items, and content. I recommend getting it on sale for $0.49 like I did, I don't feel like this classic old game is worth $4.99. It is somewhat fun, and does not take up nearly as much space as the free Team Fortress 2 Game, Team Fortress Classic is only MB, Team Fortress 2 is Gigabytes! If you want to give this classic version a try, then go ahead on it as long as you get it when it is on sale! Otherwise, I recommend to not get the game if you aren't a fan of classic games, valve games, and like team fortress 2. It would be a waste of money for you if you don't fall into those categories. Overall, I think it deserves a 8/10 actually for the game since it does have some content and runs perfectly well on my PC!

Team fortress classic brings everything from the quake mod and gives it a big facelift, at least when the game was released. If you are deciding on picking tf2 or tfc, for me for something more competitive go tfc. If you want wacky and zany, go tf2. The price, now for the game it's $5 which is not bad, but the big factor is that tf2 is $0 aka free. That's my review and remember, I'm really off-topic today for the review
